February 2012  –  April 2014  (2 years 3 months) Greater Omaha Area I actually began work with Yahoo! as a contractor in September, 2011. I was hired on and taken off the contract in February, 2012. Initially the position was Associate Account Manager, evolved to be Campaign Manager, and eventually retitled as Ad Ops Specialist. ** Was responsible for tactical operations of all accounts that I am assigned to. This included booking placements in our ad servers, assigning creative (ads), and helping the Account Managers with monitoring performance and making reallocation suggestions if needed.

** Was a part of various other micro teams within this group, working to help keep workflow moving and also looking out for potential revenue loss, calling out campaigns with missing creative. 
 
** I received several commendations from coworkers for always doing a great job and often going above and beyond to be a great teammate. Customer Service Call Center Rep First Data Corporation March 2010  –  September 2011  (1 year 7 months) During my tenure as a Customer Service Call Center Rep, I was able to gain a lot of valuable experience as I took on a variety of responsibilities over the year and a half that I was with the company. 
 
** As a Call Center Rep I delt directly with customers over the phone, helping them to solve any issues they were experiencing with our online service, taking tax payments over the phone, and offering limited advice on their tax payments while also providing them the correct State or Federal numbers to find further help regarding any issues I could not assist with. 
 
** After five months I was put on our Associate Training team, while still maintaining the title of Customer Service Call Center Rep. As a part of the AT team, I assisted with training sessions, and keeping training materials up to date with the latest policies. I also was responsible for monitoring 100% of our Financial Institution Helpline calls, to ensure reps followed all procedures, as well as to make sure we met all client goals for the FI Helpline. 
 
** With tax code changes in 2011, we had to hire and train quite a few temporary employees to help handle expected increases in call volume. I was responsible for leading my own training classes, and had around 80 students come through my course, most of which performed at a very high level when they were put on the phones after training. 
 
** In April of 2011, I was given the chance to temporarily backfill a Team Manager position in our department while the Team Manager was out on maternity leave. I was very successful in managing my team, helping coach them through their calls and raise their overall performance.
